text:
Briefly, 73M with CAD s/p CABG, DM, ESRD on HD, Afib on coumadin
   admitted to the neurology service [**8-12**] after being transferred from
   [**Hospital3 1492**] for further management of a traumatic L SDH sustained 3
   days prior to admission. Has had epileptiform behavior for which
   receiving continuous EEG monitoring and ativan boluses (1 mg IV x 3
   over past 36 hours). Had PR temp 102.5 yesterday evening. 30 minutes
   into HD session today had BP 70/23. BCx drawn from HD catheter, given
   vanc 1 g IV, gent 140 mg IV, 1 L NS. ABG 7.41/43/79/28. V/S prior to
   transfer 99.7 101/30 78 24 95%3L.
   CODE:  FULL
   ACCESS:  Right double lumen PICC, Left HD cath
   SOCIAL: Contact is with daughter [**Name (NI) **] [**Telephone/Fax (1) 8525**] who works in the
   [**Hospital 4486**] Medical Office Building.
   ROS:
   *neuro- A&Ox1 (person) and able to follow commands at times;
   moans/groans/yells out but when asked if in pain denies; pupils
   unequal, non reactive (please see below)
   *resp- satting 94-98% on 6L NC with RR 10s-20s; LS ronchorous
   throughout, congested cough present
   *CV- HR 80s SR, no ectopy; BPs ranging 100s-140s systolic; BP being
   taken on right calf as unable to take on BUE [**12-20**] PICC on right and old
   AV fistula on left
   *GI/[**Name (NI) 2861**] pt does not make urine; HD pt M/W/F, has NGT in place to right
   nare with Nutren Pulmonary Full infusing @ 10cc/hr (starting rate), tol
   without N/V, abd S/NT/slightly distended with +BS; flexiseal in place
   draining brown liquid stool
   *act- moves all extremities on bed except RUE; when extremities lifted
   up, they fall back as pt is unable to lift and hold; did wiggle toes at
   times on command
   *endo- FSBS 148 @ 1200, 147 @ 1800 requiring no insulin coverage per
   SS; also as fixed dose which was not given this am [**12-20**] NPO, but will be
   needed @ bedtime
   Fever, unknown origin (FUO, Hyperthermia, Pyrexia)
   Assessment:
   Pt with tmax 102.5 rectal on floor; transferred to MICU for fever with
   hypotension suggesting possible sepsis. Tmax 99.5 today.
   Action:
   Pt has had multiple sets blood cx, all with NGTD. On vanc/gent coverage
   for possible line infection (PICC or HD cath) though neither line
   removed at this point [**12-20**] extremely poor access. Neither line with s/s
   infection at insertion point.
   Response:
   Blood cx with NGTD. Tmax 99.5 this shift.
   Plan:
   Cont vanc/gent until blood cx results come back. Cont to monitor for
   fever, s/s sepsis.
   .H/O renal failure, End stage (End stage renal disease, ESRD)
   Assessment:
   Pt with chronic RF, on HD M/W/F. Did not tolerate HD yesterday ([**8-17**])
   [**12-20**] hypotension with fluid removal, so sent to MICU for further
   monitoring.
   Action:
   Pt had HD today.
   Response:
   Tolerated HD with VSS. 1L fluid removed.
   Plan:
   Cont with regularly scheduled HD.
   Altered mental status (not Delirium)
   Assessment:
   Pt had a repeat head CT yesterday which showed a stable subdural
   hematoma. Pt moaning, calling out. At beginning of shift able to state
   name, but unable to do so @ 1600 assessment, incomprehensible sounds to
   other questions. Follows simple commands but only at times s/a wiggling
   toes or opening mouth for mouth care. Right pupil 2-3mm, non reactive,
   impaired corneal reflex. Left pupil 5mm, non reactive, impaired corneal
   reflex; this is stable per team (h/o glaucoma, cataract surgery). Per
   daughter, pt was high functioning prior to fall and SDH.
   Action:
   Pt frequently reoriented, frequent checks for safety. Left arm in soft
   wrist restraint as pt pulled out NGT yesterday, pt unable to move RUE.
   EEG completed. No MRI this shift as it is unnecessary per neuro because
   it will not change treatment of bleed.
   Response:
   Pt stable and improving per neurological service.
   Plan:
   Continue to monitor mental status.  Call out to neuro so pt can be f/b
   neuromed service.
